Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

obsm_input.description: Type: `string`, default: `X_pca`. The dimensionality reduction in `
obsm_input.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_pca`. The dimensionality reduction in `.obsm` to use for neighbour detection. Defaults to X_pca.

obs_batch.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `batch`. .obs column name discriminating between your batches.

output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Output .h5mu file.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object
output_compression.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object.

uns_output.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `neighbors`. Mandatory .uns slot to store various neighbor output objects.

obsp_distances.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `distances`. In which .obsp slot to store the distance matrix between the resulting neighbors.

obsp_connectivities.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `connectivities`. In which .obsp slot to store the connectivities matrix between the resulting neighbors.

n_neighbors_within_batch.description: Type: `integer`, default: `3`. How many top neighbours to report for each batch; total number of neighbours in the initial k-nearest-neighbours computation will be this number times the number of batches
n_neighbors_within_batch.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `3`. How many top neighbours to report for each batch; total number of neighbours in the initial k-nearest-neighbours computation will be this number times the number of batches.

n_pcs.description: Type: `integer`, default: `50`. How many dimensions (in case of PCA, principal components) to use in the analysis
n_pcs.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `50`. How many dimensions (in case of PCA, principal components) to use in the analysis.

n_trim.description: Type: `integer`. Trim the neighbours of each cell to these many top connectivities
n_trim.help_text: Type: `integer`. Trim the neighbours of each cell to these many top connectivities. May help with population independence and improve the tidiness of clustering. The lower the value the more independent the individual populations, at the cost of more conserved batch effect. If `None` (default), sets the parameter value automatically to 10 times `neighbors_within_batch` times the number of batches. Set to 0 to skip.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
